snippet: A new report lays out a clear road map for preserving order without suspending or expelling students under “zero tolerance” policies.
abstract: Editorial supports rollback of 'zero tolerance' disciplinary policies that swept through American schools in 1990s; asserts that policies led to millions of children, particularly minorities, being suspended or expelled for minor offenses; applauds Council of State Governments Justice Center report showing that states and school districts can cut down on suspensions and unwarranted arrests at school within relatively short periods without sacrificing safety or disrupting school environment.
lead_paragraph: A new report lays out a clear road map for preserving order without suspending or expelling students under “zero tolerance” policies.
